intro: Acourtia moctezumae, commonly known as the Mexican daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant has narrow, gray-green leaves and thrives in well-drained soil. It is often found in rocky or limestone habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Acourtia moctezumae is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native environment.
